outstanding issue / incident: no issues noted.

approximately 100m north of polymoore rd, noted that there was a depression on the easement. the re-seeded vegetation has been flooded out and died. this area requires grading, and/or addition of topsoil to fill in the depression and then re-seeded with a standard ministry of transportation (mto) seed mixture.
proposed restoration: place 40 yrds topsoil, grade and seed.  will monitor and water as required.

outstanding issue / incident: approximately 50m west of the hwy 40 fence, water was noticed bubbling out of the ground at a high spot in the topography. bill taylor (nova chemicals) contacted other personnel at nova chemicals and this water issue was going to be investigated immediately. once this issue is resolved, the soil should be levelled and re-seeded with a standard mto seed mixture.
proposed restoration: the source of the leak is the river water makeup line going to the nova corunna site. repairs to stop this leak will require a plant outage to repair (scheduled for q2 2017).  – no further action at this time.

outstanding issue / incident: the remainder of this area, including the hill st. bore pipe laydown area, was graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and is growing well.

specific location: hwy 40 to of n/s portion of polymoore rd
outstanding issue / incident: land is graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and was growing well.

specific location: n/s portion of polymoore rd to rr line
outstanding issue / incident: land is graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and was growing well.

specific location: rr line to hydro one lane
outstanding issue / incident: immediately west of the gravel lane, vehicle traffic has left the lane and rutted the edge of the small portion of land between the lane and the rr line. this strip of land requires grading and/or addition of topsoil and re-seeding with a standard mto seed mixture.
proposed restoration: place 100yrd of topsoil and dump at a location appropriate for tenant farmer.
proposed schedule: farmer will distribute and grade at his discretion once the beans have been removed.

specific location: hydro one lane to hill st.
outstanding issue / incident: the soil immediately west of the fibre optic connector box has depression and needs to be leveled and/or addition of topsoil to fill in the depression.
proposed restoration: see rr line to hydro one lane. tenant farmer will address using a portion of the 100yrd topsoil.
proposed schedule: farmer will distribute and grade at his discretion once the beans have been removed.

outstanding issue / incident: the cultivated portion of this area, both the east/west and north/south portions are well graded and the planted agricultural crop has germinated and appears to be growing well.

specific location: hill st. to csx spur line
outstanding issue / incident: the cultivated portion of this area is well graded and the planted agricultural crop has germinated and appears to be growing well.
an area of standing water was observed in the middle of the field west of the pipeline construction area.
proposed restoration: pre-construction photographs and discussions with the tenant former indicate that the condition is not related to the construction of the pipeline. no further remedial action is required.

specific location: csx spur line to marsh creek
outstanding issue / incident: land is graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and was growing well.
banks are suitable, no erosion noted.

specific location: marsh creek to un-named drain in st clair river site
outstanding issue / incident: land is graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and was growing well.

specific location: un-named drain in st clair river site
outstanding issue / incident: banks are suitable, no erosion noted.

specific location: un-named drain in st clair river site to west end of “a” st.
outstanding issue / incident: land in the st. clair river sub-station site was vegetated before construction. this area should be re-seeded with a standard mto seed mixture.
proposed restoration: this area has been re-graded and stone was also laid in that area.

outstanding issue / incident: land north of “a” st. is graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and was growing well.

specific location: west end of “a” st. to csx spur at shell
outstanding issue / incident: most of this land is graded properly but some soil ruts were observed. nova chemicals should decide whether they will re-grade and re-seed with a standard mto seed mixture.
proposed restoration: use of the csx access road is for "others".  damaged caused by others, remedial action is not required.

specific location: csx spur at shell to lasalle rd station
outstanding issue / incident: land is graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and was growing well. it was noted that an integrity dig was occurring north of the csx spur line at the time of line tour.

specific location: lasalle rd station to talfourd creek
outstanding issue / incident: land is graded properly and the seeded vegetation had germinated and was growing well. no remedial action is required. it was noted that portions of the line along the fencing west of shell’s western gate had soil ruts. this was due to shell security doing perimeter tours with quads as observed by lamsar personnel. since the soil damage was caused by shell, remedial action is not required.
banks are suitable, no erosion noted.

specific location: talfourd creek to st. clair pkwy
outstanding issue / incident: there is a depression in the soil at the hdd exit pit. addition of topsoil, levelling and reseeding with a standard mto seed mix is required.  the land between the enbridge valve and the union gas valve requires re-grading and reseeding.  it appears that vehicle traffic has rutted the soil west of the nova chemicals river crossing valve. this area between the two gravel lanes should be levelled and re-seeded. it is suggested that an orange safety fence be installed to exclude vehicle traffic until the seed has germinated and established.
proposed restoration: place 25yrds of topsoil, grade and hydro-seed all three areas.
